snippet: Federal authorities say that a horse breeding organization run by one of the most wanted drug traffickers in the world and his brother allowed them to launder millions of dollars.
abstract: Justice Department raids the stables of horse-breeding organization Tremor Enterprises, which law enforcement officials say is run by Miguel Angel Trevino Morales, one of the most wanted drug traffickers in the world; officials say the operation has allowed Trevino and his brother Jose to launder millions of dollars and amounts to a foothold in the United States for one of Mexico's most dangerous criminal networks.

byline.contributor: Mike McIntire contributed reporting. Jack Begg, Alain Delaquérière and Sheelagh McNeill contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Federal authorities say that a horse breeding organization run by one of the most wanted drug traffickers in the world and his brother allowed them to launder millions of dollars.

headline.seo: Mexico’s Zetas Accused of Laundering Money With Horses
headline.main: A Drug Family in the Winner’s Circle
headline.print_headline: A Drug Family in the Winner’s Circle
